RMF Pillar Description: SSO with IdP and MFA
Suggested Action: Implementing single sign-on with an identity provider’s (IdP) multifactor authentication is critical for secure authentication. It adds an extra layer of security, ensuring that only authorized users access the Databricks Platform.

RMF Pillar Description: Sync users and groups
Suggested Action: Synchronizing users and groups enables inheritance of enterprise roles and supports role-based access control across data and AI assets.

RMF Pillar Description: Restrict access using IP access lists
Suggested Action: IP allow lists limit authentication to approved network ranges, reducing exposure to unauthorized access.

RMF Pillar Description: Restrict access using private link
Suggested Action: Private connectivity restricts inbound traffic to trusted network paths and avoids public internet exposure.

RMF Pillar Description: Control access to data and objects
Suggested Action: A centralized permissions model ensures consistent access control for data, metadata, and AI objects.

RMF Pillar Description: Classify data
Suggested Action: Data classification enables governance controls by identifying sensitivity levels and applying appropriate protections.

RMF Pillar Description: Tag and discover sensitive data
Suggested Action: Automated discovery and tagging identify sensitive data to enforce governance and compliance requirements.

RMF Pillar Description: Encrypt data at rest
Suggested Action: Encryption at rest protects stored data from unauthorized access in the event of infrastructure compromise.

RMF Pillar Description: Encrypt data in transit
Suggested Action: Encryption in transit ensures confidentiality and integrity of data exchanged between services and users.

RMF Pillar Description: Manage keys securely
Suggested Action: Centralized key management ensures secure creation, rotation, and revocation of encryption keys.

RMF Pillar Description: Validate data integrity
Suggested Action: Integrity checks ensure ingested and processed data has not been altered maliciously or accidentally.

RMF Pillar Description: Monitor data quality
Suggested Action: Continuous data quality monitoring detects anomalies that could impact model performance or integrity.

RMF Pillar Description: Monitor prompt and response logs
Suggested Action: Logging prompts and outputs supports abuse detection and compliance.

RMF Pillar Description: Secure sharing of data and models
Suggested Action: Controlled sharing prevents unintended exposure across teams or partners.

RMF Pillar Description: Implement AI guardrails
Suggested Action: Guardrails enforce safety, moderation, and compliance controls on AI outputs.

RMF Pillar Description: Use clean rooms
Suggested Action: Clean rooms enable secure, privacy-preserving collaboration without exposing raw data.

RMF Pillar Description: Rate limit number of inference queries
Suggested Action:
Enforce request-rate limits to manage traffic at the endpoint level on a per-user and per-
endpoint basis, effectively controlling access levels and volume.

RMF Pillar Description: Implement network segmentation
Suggested Action:
Establish network and security policies to define and enforce egress rules from models
and outbound network connections from your serverless compute resources.
